short_summary: Remove the breakwater and transfer the Tyee dock and breakwater to the specified spot for the test fishing season.
description: Objective of this proposal is to support the Tyee test fishery project by creating, installing, removing, and protecting necessary equipment used by the project.
full_summary:
### Tyee Test Fishing Dock Installation and Removal Tender Notice

#### Reference Number

*    General Public Reference Number: 30004052
*    Solicitation Identification Number (SIN): cb-4723-53577490

#### Publication and Closing Dates

*    Tender Publication Date: 2023-04-13
*    Tender Closing Date: 2023-04-28T13:00:00
*    Amendment Date: 2023-04-28

#### Overview

Fisheries and Oceans Canada invites proposals for the Tyee Test Fishing Dock Installation and Removal project. This Contract requires the creation, installation, removal, and protection of equipment used by the Tyee test fishery project.

#### Scope of Work

The successful Bidder will be responsible for:

*   Transferring the Tyee dock and breakwater to its operational position
*   Conducting preparatory activities at both moorage and operational locations to facilitate the installation of the Tyee dock
*   Removing the breakwater from its operational position and securing it for transport to the winter moorage location
*   Providing a vessel that meets the required specifications for towing and manipulating the dock

#### Mandatory Requirements

To be considered for further evaluation, all proposers must meet the mandatory requirements, which include:

*   Holding a minimum of 60 months (5 years) experience in ocean towing projects
*   Possessing a vessel master certificate (60 tonne or greater)
*   Proving that they will provide a vessel that meets the required specifications for towing and manipulating the dock

#### Period of Work and Security

Work on this contract is expected to commence on June 1, 2023, and conclude on March 31, 2025. Please note that this contract is not subject to any security requirements.

### Evaluation Criteria

The proposals will be evaluated based on Technical Merit. Proposers must clearly demonstrate that they meet the mandatory criteria in their submission to be considered for further evaluation.

*   Contact Information: Katie Falletta (Katie.Falletta@dfo-mpo.gc.ca)
*   Phone: (506) 238-3511
*   Fax: None
*   Locations: 200 Kent Street, Ottawa, ON K1A 0E6, Canada
*   Contract Description and Files: [URLs](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/4723/30004052---rfp.pdf)
